title: Update to rand master
body:
Temporarily, we patch this repo to use rand from git. Not ideal, but:

- It lets us get this code (mostly) ready for the next rand version now
- Lets us test the rand_core changes
- Allows us to move rand_pcg here, if we want to (possibly not; it is used by benches in the rand repo)

title: Update Criterion, MSRV
body:
This replaces #50.

All crates are now using MSRV = 1.61, the same as rand. If we're going to maintain these crates, we should at least do so using the same Rust version we use elsewhere.

To do later (in new PRs):

- rustfmt, add Clippy/rustfmt CI checks
- Depend on `rand` version from `master` until next release; move `rand_pcg` here.

title: rand_jitter v0.4, platform_ns_time feature, MSRV=1.51, rustfmt
body:
Fixes #16. ~~Hacky since it requires a nightly feature. I did try RPIT (return-position impl trait) but rustc still wants a type specification in the test.~~ RPIT does work; Rust was complaining about the (unused) type parameter `F` on the impl block.

Fixes #46: I will release after this is merged.

Apply rustfmt and Clippy to `rand_jitter`.

Bump MSRV to 1.51 for `rand_jitter` and use this version for testing all repo crates. I expect we'll see new versions of `rand_core` and RNGs with a newer MSRV anyway soon(ish) since the Rand repo is already requiring Rust 1.60.

title: reduce stack allocation in `Hc128Core::init` for embedded use
body:
hi folks, in the process of getting HC-128 working on an _very constrained_ embedded platform i noticed a double allocation in `Hc128Core::init`... 

this PR alters the init function to create the object early then reference the internal array, reducing the stack use for this function by 4kB (~40%) and letting the optimiser do it's copy-elision thing ^_^

title: Fix a typo in crate documentation
fix issue #40 : Xoshiro128Plus is missing long_jump()
Speed up from_seed implementation for 128 bit seeds
body:
When the seed is <= to 128 bits, rust will pass it in as 2 u64s. With the loop implementation, it tries to vectorize the zero checking instead of just doing a simple comparison.

```
init/init_xorshift      time:   [13.117 ns 13.151 ns 13.187 ns]                                
                        change: [-9.2724% -8.6633% -8.0756%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoshiro128starstar                                                                             
                        time:   [8.1292 ns 8.2003 ns 8.2914 ns]
                        change: [-10.792% -9.4182% -8.0231%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoshiro128plus                                                                             
                        time:   [8.0488 ns 8.0896 ns 8.1361 ns]
                        change: [-12.104% -10.950% -9.7502%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoshiro128plusplus                                                                             
                        time:   [8.0522 ns 8.0966 ns 8.1501 ns]
                        change: [-6.1578% -4.1022% -2.2845%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoroshiro128starstar                                                                             
                        time:   [8.0174 ns 8.0698 ns 8.1306 ns]
                        change: [-0.9823% -0.1486% +0.6948%] (p = 0.73 > 0.05)
                        No change in performance detected.

init/init_xoroshiro128plus                                                                             
                        time:   [8.0619 ns 8.1162 ns 8.1764 ns]
                        change: [-27.151% -22.535% -17.775%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoroshiro64starstar                                                                             
                        time:   [5.9494 ns 6.0973 ns 6.2632 ns]
                        change: [-10.426% -8.3498% -6.3628%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

init/init_xoroshiro64star                                                                             
                        time:   [5.9437 ns 6.1001 ns 6.3045 ns]
                        change: [-15.615% -12.531% -9.6632%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
```

title: Fix broken init benchmark macro + ergonomic improvements
body: @vks @dhardy I messed up the macro. :grimacing: Double checked the others and they look good.

title: Add comment explaining shift amounts for xorshift
body: This is a very tiny PR, but when reviewing the code I was wondering where the constants in Xorshift came from. I added a comment explaining that.

title: Replace Travis CI reference with GitHub Actions
Add `rand_hc`
body: This was moved from the `rand` repository.

title: Document how xorshift avoids zero seeds
fix Miri flag passing
body: With https://github.com/rust-lang/miri/pull/1769 having landed, the old way of passing flags to Miri will soon stop working. This updates the CI to the new way.
